Amazing!  We had appetizers that were out of this world. The Jalape√±o Relleno was to die for. When the Manager found out this was our first time, she offered us a complementary dessert. Very nice & yummy too.
I just changed their menu it's a little more streamlined now.  I had the plato burro with carnitas, chimichonga style. some of the best  carnitas I've ever had!

3 stars for service, 4 stars for food & price. I've been here at least 5 times and it is always good. They have TVs in the bars, the actual restaurant is a little messy and the hostesses are less than inviting mostly. The place is a little off the beaten path to say the least. There is another one in downtown Cave Creek.

We went there on a Monday afternoon.  It was slightly crowded.  We sat in the bar area.  It took a while to be noticed.  We placed our order which came in good time.  The meal was terrible.  I ordered pollo fundido and did not like it at all.  The only thing I could taste was sour cream.  I would not go back, I would sooner drive to Phoenix and get better food.

Had fun at the open Catina area, but that's about all. This was only our second time at El Encanto Dos, but it was not any better. Food is mediocre at best and over priced for Mexican food. Our server had no personality what so ever. It seems that more and more servers are from Boringtown. The service was extremely slow as well. With plenty of Mexican food restaurants to choose from, this one is STILL at the bottom of our list.

Really great Mexican food. Salsa, all three of them are house made and delicious.  Meat is always flavorful and side are the bomb.  You should come try it. Less crowded than #1 and we think the food is better here as well.
Pretty good Mexican food.  The atmosphere is great.
Get the pollo fundido and a pitcher of margaritas! It's the best! The sampler with the fundido is also great to share
Margaritas are the best anywhere!    Love the staff, love the service!  This is the first place we take out of town guests and they immediately feel right at home.  Always our #1 choice!

Been here several times and this location tends to be hit and miss. The Cadillac margaritas are always consistent and the salsa. The food not so much. It was fairly good this visit...had tequila lime shrimp and both the shrimp and veggies were good; although the rice was on the dry side. Love the festive environment and patio!

I went to this restaurant for the first time today because I am tired of the wait times at the original El Encanto in downtown Cave Creek - especially when the snow birds are in town. So I figured I'd rather be driving than twiddling my thumbs. I'm so glad I drove out to this one. Same excellent food, services, and prices. The inside and patio are HUGE and much nicer than one might think looking at it from the road. I wanted to watch a football game and was so pleased that they have booths in the bar area.  From now on, I am driving directly to this one first. One caveat: It's kind of out in the middle of nowhere and if you blink you might miss it. Use your Nav or GPS the 1st time.

Horrible food, great service but very disappointed in the food definitely not true authentic Mexican food. More Americanized then I'd like. Tried it for the second time perhaps it's what I ate the last time. I will not return to eat here.

Take out or sit down and be served...this joint is consistent in both service and quality. There is a 50% chance of your server being friendly. There is a 99% chance your server will be competent. Not once have they screwed up my special orders. They have know how and when to upsell. The food is fresh. The place is clean. They are not slow or shy to refill the chips and salsa. I even dig the other customers. It's just a laid back place to get your grub on. Cheers!

Went in last night everything was great, we always order the south of the border sampler which has a little bit of everything and plenty to take home...pollo fundido, tostadas, mini chimis, taquitos and beans...yum yum wish they had this at the other one on cave creek but they took it off the menu years ago and changed it up to things we don.t like....miss the turtles in the pond!!

The place is very expansive with a great patio and garden area.  My boyfriend had been here several times in the past, and raved about their Pollo Fundido; however when he ordered his favorite dish it turned out to be the worst Fundido he'd ever received. The chicken was dry and there were only a few flakes of cheese on what was supposed to be an indulgent dish,  and to top it all off they got rid of the refried beans that used to come with the dish. I ordered the Pablano Relleno,  and although my dish was rather tasty with ample helpings of Carnitas and a wonderfully spicy green sauce... the rice that accompanied it was as dry as space food. Overall I'd say they need to step up their game on quality,  but I'd be willing to give them another shot.

I Love this place!  It's one of my favorites in the valley!  My kids love the ducks and I love the food.  The patio is beautiful on a fall day with the fun view of the duck pond and the shade from the giant trees.  One tree is built into the building.
Filthy dirty menus with food stains all over. Margarita is watered down and waitress said they made the batch in the morning. No tequila. What?  Unpleasant experience

Came here to celebrate a friends promotion, house purchase and new business opening. While waiting for the third and fourth of our party a waiter walks a man up to our table and the man accuses me of "stealing his reservation" he's hostile and yelling and accusatory that I stole a reservation I made with my girlfriends.  The wait staff had the man confront me. Completely out of line and quite frankly not my issue.  Owner was polite and apologetic. With ample seating available not sure what happened or why. Have not been back and don't plan on it.

The atmosphere is what really makes this place. The waterfall out front, the cantina feel of the outside eating, the decorative tables and art on the walls all lends to the good feelings you get when you walk in.  The food is great as well. The mole sauce is one of the best I've had. You will not go wrong if you're looking for great Mexican food.

Flavorless salsa, but maybe it is the head cold.  I had a bowl of Albongas soup which was actually pretty good.  Still prefer a bowl accompanied by flour tortillas, chopped onion and cilantro.  The taquitos were comparable to anything I could get in frozen section of grocery aisle.  The guacamole that topped taquitos was poor.  All in all not a great meal.  Service and decor were great though.

Ok, here it goes. Came here with my wife for her birthday. Upon arrival, looks great, pond out front is a nice touch. Outdoor seating in the right weather looks like it could be really nice. Inside, its fine.   Chips and salsa were delivered right away, and quite good to boot.   Wife ordered chicken fajitas and I ordered beef fajitas. When they arrived, everything seemed OK, although both seemed overly greasy, and after a few bites, it was very greasy. The beef and the chicken had zero seasoning on them, they were both very bland. The sides they give to build the fajita are ok, but no sour cream? Seemed odd to have to pay for a side of sour cream when we were paying $18 per plate of fajitas. The house-made guac was very average. One last note about the beef - it was cooked to well done which made it quite tough. The portions were quite large.   The service was good; offered informed suggestions and was prompt and polite.    Overall, the experience was fun with the wifey. But the $18 fajitas left much to be desired. Havent decided if we will give this place another try.
The chicken tacos are good be ready to translate the menu with your phone if Spanish isn't your primary language though

Sat in the patio area, very nice with the heaters. Started with bean dip, really good. Chips and 3 salsas were great. Cheese/ chicken enchiladas were really tasty. Tortilla soap was good. Service was a bit slow, more servers were needed.

The food is outstanding.  I've had several different entrees and liked them all.  I love the salsa trio to get my meal started as well.  The main issue here is the service.  Things tend to move slow and you often have to grab your servers attention.  If you can handle that consistent issue the food is well worth it!

We have driven by this place multiple times and it is always packed.  We finally decided to give it a try, even with the mixed reviews.  We loved it!  We sat outside and the service was great. They give you three different salsa types to go with the chips and I thought they were all excellent.  There were four of us and we all agreed that the food was outstanding.  This is a place I would go back to and would recommend to others.  It also has a very cool bar area and would probably be a fun place in the evening.  Highly recommended.

Disappointed.  We finally had a chance to try this place.  45 minute wait for two people on a Friday at 6.  The food was pretty aweful. We started with grilled stuffed jalepenos.  The plate was covered in filler, but we could only find one jalepeno.  My Plato Mexicano must have sat on the warming tray a while because the plate was too hot to touch, but the beans and sauces all had a film on them.  The tamale was dry and way too thick while the taco was stale.  Just a big let down overall.  The service was ok once we got a table and the location looks like it would be a great place for a drink after the summer hear passes, but we probably won't be back for dinner.
Horrible!!! My food was cold and so were the chips. I have been here twice thinking that everybody has a bad day, but the second time was just as bad as the first.

I'm still stewing about the experience I had here last night. Bear with me on the length.... I'm THAT annoyed.  El Encanto has been a hit or miss for many years as far as the food. Boyfriend and I stopped in last month and were pleasantly surprised.... except for the service. Our server, a 30s something woman (whereas the others looked reasonably young), is just one of those people who should not be waiting tables, both from lack of customer skills and memory and just obviously not wanting to be there. We were too tired to get annoyed though.  We took my mom out for her birthday last night to El Encanto, and got the exact same server. Ugh.  Now, I've been waiting tables since I was 16, ranging from fine dining snobbery in Scottsdale to a Dennys to the Roadrunner Saloon where biker fights break out weekly. In NONE of those would her service have been acceptable.  1) Her style is awkward, rude and abrupt - she interrupted us mid-sentence multiple times, kept hovering over the table while we were eating, etc.  When I ordered a margarita, I had to repeat "on the rocks with salt" multiple times... what waitress can't remember a frickin' diet Coke, a margarita and a sangria?... and instead of asking me for my ID, she just stood there and stared at me (I rarely get carded, so it's not a habit to pull it out, and you still need to ASK, lady). I also mentioned it was my mom's birthday and she didn't wish her happy birthday, no candles on the dessert, nothing.  2) We somehow ended up being brought the pitcher of water and one water glass. What? There's three of us here, 2 of whom have alcohol... at least assume 2 glasses. We also had no silverware.  3) She VANISHED. Like, Harry Potter, Invisibility Cloak status vanished. Our drinks were brought by a manager, our food and silverware by a bus boy, the manager checked back on us, etc. We didn't interact with her again (except for her awkward hovering throughout dinner) until she came to whisk plates away and plop the check down....   4) You don't freaking drop the check without asking for dessert - what, are you nuts? Do you not want your check and tip to go up?! That's server 101. "Hey, we want dessert." She brought a menu, not 20 seconds later swooped back to say "Did we see a dessert we want?"  and then I made my fatal mistake: I asked for another minute. This minute turned into literally 10 minutes (we clocked it!)  We finally order it, someone else plunks it down along with our check.  15. Dang. Minutes. After we're finished with our dessert. That's how long we waited, too hopefully, for her to come pick up the check. I was steaming to the point of wanting to dine n dash.   Finally I take it to the hostess stand and tell the manager I need to pay but our waitress has been.... She finishes my sentence with "AWOL?"   Gee, how did you know?  If you know she's been AWOL and is a terrible server, why is she still serving?  The manager merely ran my card, apologized with a robotic "I'm sorry about that", explained to me that one copy of the receipts was mine and the other theirs (who the hell doesn't know that?) and went back to the bar to talk to the bartender. No drink comps, no offer to make it right, nothing.  This is the first time I've ever totally stiffed a waitress, but it was the worst service any of us had ever gotten, and hey, you work for your tip. This is the first time I've ever had an issue in a restaurant and not at least gotten a sincere apology and an attempt to rectify it. To think I paid $67 for 3 people (without tip!) to get treated like we didn't matter, is ridiculous.  We will NOT be back, El Encanto, EVER.

I joined a large group at the El Encanto DOS on Friday, March 10th. We had reservations knowing that it would likely be very busy. Unfortunately there was a mix-up with our reservation on arrival but it was resolved quickly and cementing 4-star status.  Our table was outside on the large patio, which was perfect given the seasonal weather (daytime high 88). The chips and salsa were solid with three salsa selections. My preference would be to kick up the heat a bit on the third salsa selection. I kept my dinner order simple with chicken tacos. The tacos, refried beans, and rice were all satisfying. El Encanto is not a premier eatery but the ambiance and service make a return visit likely.

Weird that there are no reviews since last July on this place???  I have been here many times as it is 10 mins away from my house.  I do like the location because you feel you are right out in the desert and the outdoor sitting is nice.  Inside in the main dining section can be VERY noisy if it is busy.  Lots of families and kids too sometimes.  I just went on a Friday night and had a decent experience.  They have live music some nights, which is nice but can just add to the noise level.    The margaritas are very good.  Free salsa and chips are good.  Food can be a little hit or miss sometimes.  I usually get the Pollo Fundido and it has ranged from really good to okay on several occasions.  I think sometimes it is sitting under a heat lamp too long.  I did notice on this visit that the portion sizes have shrunk and the prices have remained the same, so I guess management finally have moved the way of many chain restaurants to squeeze more profits.  The food tends to be very salty.  Wait staff can be hit or miss too.  Friday night, the waitress was super busy and you could tell probably had too many tables but we got what we ordered in a fairly timely manner. Probably would give them 3.5 stars but that isn't an option on Yelp.  Will continue to go back.

I am not in love with Mexican food. I'll just start my review off with that. I mean, I'll eat it and I will enjoy it (usually), but I'd rather have a steak or a burger if you give me the choice. Ok, now that that's out of the way, I love this restaurant. We have been here several times in the two years we have lived here. The food is consistently good. I love the Pollo Fundido, which is like the best thing ever. You can refer to their website for the rest of their menu, with descriptions. Also, their burgers are better than a lot of American restaurants that I have been to! I don't know what they do differently, but the meat is so tender and perfectly cooked. My son and husband have gotten it before and I almost second guessed my Pollo Fundido decision, but I just took a bite of theirs first and everything was good. Okay, now, for the 21+crowd, their mango margaritas are the bomb. I mean like, you can set your straw in the middle of the cup and it won't tip over, it is so thick. The flavor is perfection, not too much sweet and not too much alcohol. The service is usually better when you go a little earlier in the evening, before it gets busy (and it will get busy), then the waiters usually seem to drown a little bit. Even with that, I can't think of an occasion where we've had BAD service, just less attentive once the crowd hits. So, if you are craving some delicious Mexican food & drinks, try this place out. I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

We had a party of 10 celebrating a birthday! Everything went amazing. We had Venus as a waitress, she was one of the best waitress I have ever had. Drinks were great, food was amazing and service was excellent!!!

We recently moved to the mountains and this is the closest restaurant to our house. GOOD THING! Because it's the new favorite restaurant of ours! We've been greeted by the staff every time we go in; The service was exceptional - We ordered the Pollo Fundido and the Steak Fajitas, which were both amazing! The server never let our iced tea get past half empty; The Manager - on most occasions - is moving between the bar tables & restaurant tables making sure everyone is happy. Speaking of Happy...Happy hour here is GREAT - even though we don't drink! The specials are good - and the atmosphere is FUN. If you have room - try the dessert - chocolate chimi's = OMG it was home made ice cream - this day it was a fresh French vanilla - with mini-chocolate filled chimis! Delicious! This is our new "Cheers" - like seeing friends every time!

I've loved everything I've ever ordered off the menu especially the Pollo fun Dedo it is the best by far! Service is always great friendly and on top of things. Nothing to complain about not even the cleanliness!

This place was recommended to me by one of my neighbors as the "go to " mexican place to eat with my family, so i decided to give it a try.  The food was very tasty, I had the chicken burro. You get so much for the money which is a good thing in these economic times!  The premade magaritas will make you smack yo mama. Mango is my absolute favorite.  Give the other flavors a try, you may find your as well.   One flaw that I found was the dirty menus, but all in all, a good place to take a hot date if you enjoy a romantic atmosphere with desert landscaping out in the sticks....Peace

It's a beautiful atmosphere. Looks fun. We got sat in a booth and I have an infant in a car set, in the locked down booths that don't move. We couldn't shift the car seat in the booth. So, the host brought us a high chair. The server comes barreling over telling us my daughter there was a safety hazard and my daughter couldn't be in a high chair at the end of the booth. She was in the way. She wanted us to put her in the booth, we couldn't and so we had to pack up and move. I felt unwelcomed and disrespected. As many restaurants I have worked at it has NEVER been an issue to have a car seat in a high chair by a booth. I wanted to leave and mom wanted to give it a chance. Food was bad and I felt comfortable with that entire trip there. Never ever again.

Frozen Margarita is awesome. Food is consistently good.  The specials are worth trying for sure!  Atmosphere is relaxed and an easy location for the neighborhood friends to gather.  Drive the UTV or horses up for a dinner is a great start to the weekend!

So the second you pull up you know this place is fancy. It's pretty large and there are a lot of fixtures to greet you to know that you are not in just some random Mexican place. We sat outside on a warm February evening and had great service. It was great to have different types of salsa to dip the chips in. Reason why they get two stars is because the food was just very meh. I had a taco salad and considering most taco salads are pretty large, this one was pretty small even though it was over $10. Just iceberg lettuce that tasted pretty cheap, not a lot of beans, hardly any cheese, but good chunk of meat though. I was hoping for more balance but I didn't really get it. My dad got something a bit different but overall he said his didn't taste that flavorful. Honestly everything was just very Bland and it's unfortunate as this place could offer a lot. It might be geared towards the pallets of the area but for me, no bueno. Find another place if you're looking for not only more authentic flare, but more overall taste in general.

I'm hooked on their steak quesadilla with green chili sauce like a ten dollar hooker to crack. It's that good. I have dreams about it.  Damn good strawberry margaritas as well.  And like Daren writes, the pollo fundido is pretty amazing. Also recommend the pollo chimi with green chili sauce and sour cream. Or red chili sauce... Both are great.  Best Mexican I've found anywhere in the valley so far.  Bring your appetite because the portions are huge.  My only gripes are that the service at the inside bar almost always sucks and the cheapskate moron of an owner needs to fix the ridiculous urinal that's about 10' off the floor in the men's bathroom.
Food was surprisingly good.   Salsas were good.   Refried beans were really good.   Kids ate well.  So did the adults.  We will be back.

I love their new menu items (new a year or so ago). I highly recommend their veggie enchiladas, even my chicken loving husband loves them. This place has improved quite a bit over the years.   Fast, friendly and helpful 5 star service. Good good and great drinks. Perfect chips and a variety of decent salsa. All right in my neighborhood!

This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants and they do Mexican food right! High quality ingredients and terrific service make it a great place. Don't miss their flagship store in Cave Creek and be sure to sit outside!

Mid grade Mexican joint. Not worth driving out to Carefree Highway for. The chicken fajitas were just okay. The chips were bland. The queso was...strange. The service was good and we got seated right next to the pond which offered a nice view.

We went there today for an early dinner. They gave us a nice seat in the dining room even though the bar and outside were the choices.      My wife had the veggie enchilada dinner and I the beef enchiladas. Both were delicious. Not the usual fair of most Mexican eateries. Mine was very flavorful and my wife agreed that hers was also.       Our waitress Wendy was very attentive and personable!        We will definitely come back!

This is our local joint and a favorite place to visit for a tasty meal.  The staff is friendly, and most of the time on the ball.  Be prepared to wait on a Friday or Saturday night.  The big hit, the Pollo Fundito, best in the North Phoenix area.  Pork Carnitas are great to!  Margarita fan, well this is the place.  Get the frozen (they are more potent) and sit back on the patio.  They grow fresh veggies right there on location.   A staple restaurant for this family and worth the trip up to Desert Hills.

Went back with a friend of mine (not my choice) from out of town who LOVED Encanto when she lived here. I tried convincing her to go elsewhere because the place is so awful now. Well, our drinks were horrible to start off with. A pi√±a colada that was riddled with ice chunks, no flavor, and half of the glass was filled with whipped cream. Ordering the pollo fundido, I got what I expected. A dry, flavorless chicken filling wrapped in a greasy tortilla. The fundido sauce WAS good, however it was cold, and just not worth the jacked up price they charge. Never. Ever. Again. Even if an out of town friend wants to go. I'll take my business down the road to Plaza Bonita instead.

The food is not "super" authentic Mexican. I normally get the Pollo Fundido. I like it, but the drawback is service is almost always slow there. Some of the food I find pricey for what you get. My husband and I ordered take out last month and he ordered a cup of soup, $7.00, and no joke, it was no bigger than a condiment cup. I was annoyed enough that I wanted to call the restaurant and he just said let it go-he was hungry and luckily had ordered enchiladas. Previous time we had gone in and my friend ordered the fajitas, waitress asked if she wanted all the "normal" things with it, my friend said sure. Well when the bill came, they charged her $1.95 for sour cream, $1.50 for cheese, $2.00 for guacamole and $1.50 for pico de gallo. So when the waiter came back and we pointed it out, she said "well you said everything- so is this a problem?" My friend wont go back since that. I dont blame her. I have had them inconsistent on pricing before when Ive ordered. Its nearby our house and the margaritas are good and my husband likes their soup, so thats why we continue.

Exceptionally popular and large restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating. I stopped in at a perfect time between rushes and received excellent service. I had shrimp tacos that were good. Unfortunately I mistakenly chose a jalape√±o appetizer. With a half of a bite my mouth and throat were on fire. I had never tasted anything that hot.

Food was not worth the price at all. We waited 25 mins for our bill to come. Our waitress had 2 tables. We watched as the managers went to multiple tables to check in who had just been sat. No one can over to us at all. Not worth the drive to get here at all.

So we thought we'd give it another shot - either we're a glutton for punishment or we are forgiving kind of folks....    Happily, I can report that this meal was wonderful!  We sat in a booth in the bar area.  Jessica was our server and she was the BEST server we've had ever in the years we've been coming to this place.  The food was very fresh, tasty, hot and yummy.  The XX was cold and the service was perfection.  Yay El Encanto Dos for hiring qualified servers who actually want to be there!   Good on ya!

I've been here twice in the past 3 weeks.  The first time was for a huge girl scout leader award dinner.  We had our food catered and it was delicious.  They gave us more than enough food and the service was fine--nothing special.  I probably would have given it a 4-star rating.  But last week we came here for a happy hour/good bye party and it was awful!!! When I came in a little late, I went straight to the bar for my drink.  It's a good thing I did because the bartender was also our server and I later found out that he hadn't even served our table their drinks yet.  So I received my drink before everyone else who had been there a lot earlier than I had.  The bartender was extremely rude and unhappy.  He seemed flustered the entire time.  I'm not sure why we didn't have another server out there since there were about 20-30 of us.  The restaurant was pretty empty besides us.  This was a Thursday at about 5pm.  I went to the bar to order my food since all my friends were complaining about how slow he was with ordering from the table.  Luckily I think a manager came by and saw me waiting at the bar, so he took my order.  I ordered the street tacos from the happy hour menu.  Yuck.  I didn't care for them at all.  I just ate the carne asada off the taco.  My margarita was okay, but I had to repeatedly go to the bathroom to wash my hands because the syrup must have been all over the glass making my hands sticky.  The floor was also gross and sticky.  My shoes were sticking as I walked.  My biggest complaint however, was that they would not honor their happy hour prices for us.  Their reasoning was because we had such a big group.  I think that is ridiculous and unfair.  I plan a lot of happy hours for my work, and I will never plan one for here again.  They will be missing out on a lot of business.  Oh well....  It's too bad because I have heard that they have really good food.  I just don't think I'll be here again.
A favorite place in north Phoenix for Mexican food.  Friendly staff and it is not too loud, so you can carry on a conversation.  The Pollo Fundido is excellent.

Nothing special about this restaurant. At best mediocre quality food and service. They claim to have their own veggie garden but my salad reflect opposite. Not worth a special trip to try out this restaurant.
Great staff great food can never give a five star to any one who has no wi fi.  All so my arms are sticking to the bar top.

I was pleasantly surprised how good the food was here because of low Yelp rating. It was on my path and my teenage son and his friend wanted to eat here. I'm glad we did. The food was delicious and full of flavor, very authentic. However, the service was slow. It wasn't crowded or busy either eating here around 2pm. Go for the food; not service.

This is a nice hidden restaurant in north Phoenix. It's culturally decorated with nice scenery for photos. The pricing is reasonable too. The menu is basic. It's good, don't get me wrong, but their items are so traditional They don't have anything new to try or something that makes them stand out. Overall, I'd go back.

We live very close to "Dos" so we know the manager, most of the wait staff, and just about every item on the  menu.   On the weekends, Maria is the best manager if you have any issues or want to pay a compliment - she is great.  Ask for Isla as a waitress if she's working - she's the best.  Just about everything on the menu is worth getting except the red tamales (substitute the green corn tamale and you won't be disappointed) and the fish tacos can be a little light on the fish.  If it's the chef's special night - go with the special... usually, it's really fantastic.  The chicken enchiladas mole is really good if you like mole. It's all good - including the desserts.  I highly recommend this restaurant if you want good mexican food in a laid back atmosphere - and if the weather is pristine, you'll want to sit outside!

Tried "Dos" for the first time last night.  The original in Cave Creek has been a tradition for years in my family.      I was pleasantly surprised!  We sat on the patio which was beautiful and had a great view.  Service was fantastic and we ordered prickly pear margaritas and pollo fundido all around.  Food was fast and great.  Not one complaint from our party of six.  If you don't want to deal with tourists, El Encanto Dos is every bit as fantastic as the first restaurant.  We'll be back!

This is the second visit for me.  Met some friends that live in the far north valley for some good food and conversation, unfortunately, only good conversation ensued.  We had a reserved table, so there was no waiting, despite the parking lot being packed - this place appears to be quite popular.  Both times I've been here on a Saturday night I've ended up parking in the back dirt lot.  Not a big deal, at least it's not valet parking.  Met our friends and ordered drinks.  I ordered a margarita on the rocks.  The drink was syrupy-sweet and there was no tequila taste whatsoever.  I dunno, maybe they got it mixed up with a virgin drink.  At any rate, I went with iced tea after that, which was fresh and tasty.  For dinner, I had the Pollo Fundido.  So many people seemed to like this, that it was a natural choice.  Too bad I did not share their appreciation for this dish.  The Jalapeno cream cheese "sauce" coating was dried on and hardly had any flavor, much like the dry-chicken filling which tasted like, well, dry chicken.  A little seasoning and spice would have gone a long way.  Service was great, our server, Chelsea, was spot-on, giving us our space to converse and being there with what we needed when we needed it.  Would I be back?  Only if I have to, definitely not for the food.
